#ResponsibleSourcing: DMT on-site in Madagascar for a verification of artisanal and small-scale mining How does DMT GROUP contribute to responsible sourcing? For example with verifications! Here you can see our DMT expert Lukas F√∂rster who is conducting with Herman Cornelissen an on-site verification of working conditions and material sourcing at small-scale mica mines in the south of Madagascar. #Mica, a group of silicate minerals, is essential for modern electric car batteries, electric wiring and many other components in construction or cosmetics. Madagascar has significant amounts of mica of excellent quality and often supplies refiners in China, which then distribute the mica to major car manufacturers in Europe and elsewhere. Mica from Madagascar is usually extracted by artisanal and small-scale mining (#ASM) using manual tools and labor-intensive methods. ‚ÄúTherefore, verification of mica plays a vital role in ensuring compliance with established #ESG standards and safeguarding the integrity of global supply chains‚Äù, Lukas F√∂rster points out. DMT‚Äôs verification of the respective mine sites assessed the compliance of the mica mines with the established ESG standard for these operations: RMI‚Äôs mica #CRAFT Code. The CRAFT code is an open source tool that supports ASM operators in responsible mining. DMT remains committed to accountable, responsible minerals sourcing and ESG performance. Our international teams are travelling the globe to ensure the integrity of the supply chains to responsible manufacturers. You want to know more about ESG compliance, supply chain integrity, and responsible sourcing? Please feel free to reach out to Lukas F√∂rster or Herman Cornelissen. #engineeringperformance

Exploring geotechnical frontiers: Insights from #Eurock2024 At the ISRM European Rock Mechanics Symposium in Alicante, Spain, our DMT experts Torsten Gorka and Florian Beier presented insights from a comprehensive #geotechnical study conducted at an iron ore site in Uzbekistan. This study and the analysis of geotechnical and structural data are key to mineral reserve estimation and strategic mine planning, including innovative mining concepts, pit optimisation, layout design, sequencing, long-term scheduling and equipment selection. Eurock provided a platform for our team and all attendees to engage with global perspectives, exchange ideas and explore new approaches in rock mechanics. A special highlight for our team was the geological exploration tour along the north coast of Alicante. This boat trip, where they were shown and explained the unique geological features of the area, allowed them to understand the relationship between the current coastal landscape and the geological history of Alicante ‚Äì a unique experience for all participants. Many thanks to the International Society for Rock Mechanics and Rock Engineering (ISRM) and University of Alicante for organising this event and creating this experience to share our insights and engage with industry professionals. To find out more about the geotechnical study in Uzbekistan and discuss the future of geotechnical exploration, get in touch with us and connect with our experts.
